item.title: Indian fintech Jar turns cash flow positive
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Indian fintech Jar has turned cash flow positive, an executive at the Tiger Global-backed startup confirmed on Wednesday. The three-year-old startup, which offers savings and investment services to consumers, achieved the milestone while still growing by more than 10 times last year, according to an investor note seen by TechCrunch. The profitability push comes as […]

item.title: Vertice raises $50M for its AI-powered SaaS spend platform
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
Vertice has made a name for itself over the years in the crowded world of expenditure management by focusing on applying AI to optimize an area where businesses are sinking hundreds of billions of dollars annually: software and cloud spend. The London-based startup’s business has grown 13x in the three years since its inception (similar […]

item.title: Truecaller brings real-time caller ID to iPhone users

item.description:
Truecaller for iOS has been updated with live caller ID support for its premium iPhone users.

item.title: Trump pardons Silk Road creator Ross Ulbricht
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
President Trump on Tuesday pardoned Ross Ulbricht, the creator of the infamous dark web exchange Silk Road, which was best known as a once-thriving online marketplace for illegal drugs. Trump announced the news in a Truth Social post, saying the pardon was in honor of Ulbricht’s mother and the Libertarian movement. In 2015, a federal […]

item.title: MrBeast is reportedly now among those trying to buy TikTok
item.dc:creator: Charles Rollet
item.description:
An unlikely group, including Mr Beast and Bench acquirer Employer.com, has submitted a bid to buy TikTok.

item.title: Former Meta COO Sheryl Sandberg sanctioned by judge for allegedly deleting emails
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
A Delaware judge has sanctioned Sheryl Sandberg, Meta’s former COO and board member, for allegedly deleting emails related to the Cambridge Analytica privacy scandal. The decision arises from a case Meta shareholders brought against Sandberg and another former Meta board member, Jeff Zients, late last year. The plaintiffs alleged that Sandberg and Zients used personal […]

item.title: Microsoft is no longer OpenAI’s exclusive cloud provider
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Microsoft was once the exclusive provider of data center infrastructure for OpenAI to train and run its AI models. No longer. Coinciding with the announcement of Stargate, OpenAI’s massive new AI infrastructure deal with SoftBank, Oracle, and others, Microsoft says it has signed a new agreement with OpenAI that gives it “right of first refusal” […]

item.title: OpenAI teams up with SoftBank and Oracle on $500B data center project
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
OpenAI says that it will team up with Japanese conglomerate SoftBank and with Oracle, among others, to build multiple data centers for AI in the U.S. The joint venture, called the Stargate Project, will begin with a large data center project in Texas and eventually expand to other states. The companies expect to commit $100 billion […]

item.title: Scale AI’s Alexandr Wang has published an open letter lobbying Trump to invest in AI
item.dc:creator: Charles Rollet
item.description:
Scale AI's CEO Alexandr Wang has five recommendations for President Trump to keep the US ahead of China on AI.

item.description:
Meta’s Reality Labs is expanding its lineup of AI smart glasses with a new pair of Oakley-branded spectacles targeted at athletes, according to Bloomberg’s Mark Gurman. Bloomberg reports the new smart glasses, with which Meta seeks to capitalize on the Ray-Ban Meta’s success, will be based on Oakley’s Sphaera glasses and will shift the camera […]

item.title: Perplexity launches Sonar, an API for AI search
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Perplexity on Tuesday launched an API service called Sonar, allowing enterprises and developers to build the startup’s generative AI search tools into their own applications. “While most generative AI features today have answers informed only by training data, this limits their capabilities,” Perplexity wrote in a blog post. “To optimize for factuality and authority, APIs […]

item.title: Trump targets EV charging funding programs Tesla benefits from
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description:
President Donald Trump is trying to halt the flow of funding for EV charging infrastructure from two programs that have benefited Tesla — the latest example of how Elon Musk’s political interests seem to be at odds with his car company’s goal of advancing sustainable energy. It’s not a given that Trump’s gambit will succeed. […]

item.title: Spotify’s educational audio courses could be coming to US
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Spotify is expanding its streaming service to now include educational courses in addition to music, podcasts, and audiobooks. The company on Tuesday referenced one of its newer features called courses, which allow users to learn about topics in areas like business, tech, lifestyle, music, and more. The feature is initially being piloted in the U.K., […]

item.description:
Meta is luring TikTok creators over to its platforms with the promise of cash bonuses, content deals, and support to grow their communities. item.title: Stripe is laying off 300 people, but says it still plans to hire in 2025
item.dc:creator: Mary Ann Azevedo
item.description:
Fintech giant Stripe is laying off 300 people, according to a leaked memo reported on Tuesday by Business Insider. The affected employees are “largely in product, engineering, and operations roles,” the memo said. Despite the layoffs, Chief People Officer Rob McIntosh said that Stripe intends to still grow its headcount by 17% “to land at […]
